column4: Everyone, I could use some help when you get a chance. I was resizing a linux partition to fill space from deleting a windows partition when there was a power interruption. Now the partition is messed up.
﻿Aeron|mtf: ubuntu-restricted-extras
how is the partition messed up?
Well, gparted shows a smaller partition of unknown type in the space I wanted / to occupy.
is anything on that partition?
I don't know. unknown type of partition.
I meant, if we completely eliminate that partition and start fresh, will you lose anything?
﻿Aeron|mtf: that's a package, not a repository
﻿angusthefuzz: yeah, that was the / partition
﻿angusthefuzz: no recent backups either, if I remember correctly
the only method i know of to recover anything requires a free partition that is larger than the one you are trying to recover
do you have any other empty drives in the machine?
﻿angusthefuzz: I have a 250gb external hd. That might work.
what is the filesystem that was on the drive?
﻿angusthefuzz: ext3
well at least its not reiser
﻿Aeron|mtf: google it. it is a package.
I used this tutorial before in a similar situation, it worked as advertised
﻿angusthefuzz: Ok, what do I do?
http://linux.about.com/od/ptn_howto/a/hwtptn09.htm
thanks!
theoretically you just messed up your partition table, at least i hope
I will cross my fingers for you
